sense.gloss: to sink, to go under, to submerge
to go down (e.g. sun), to set, to descend
to feel depressed, to become subdued, to become somber
having too much fun (esp. in a red-light district, etc.) and missing work or neglecting one's duties
staying in one place for a long time
(attacking and) sinking (a ship), sending (a ship) to the bottom
composure, calmness, self-possession, presence of mind
depositing (at the bottom), deposition, accumulation, adherence

sdata.j: ↑沈黙↑↓ちんもく↓は↑同意↑↓どうい↓を↑表↑↓あらわ↓す。
↑沈黙↑↓ちんもく↓は↑承諾↑↓しょうだく↓の↑印↑↓しるし↓。
↑窓↑↓まど↓から↑日↑↓ひ↓が↑沈↑↓しず↓むのを↑見↑↓み↓ることができるだろう。
sdata.e: We could see the sunset from the window.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑犬↑↓いぬ↓は↑本当↑↓ほんとう↓に↑意気↑↓いき↓↑消沈↑↓しょうちん↓しているのだろう。
sdata.e: Your dog may be really depressed.

sdata.j: ↑気↑↓き↓まずい↑沈黙↑↓ちんもく↓の↑後↑↓のち↓、ビルは↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑取↑↓と↓って↑上↑↓うえ↓の↑階↑↓かい↓へ↑引↑↓ひ↓っ↑張↑↓ぱ↓って↑行↑↓い↓った。
sdata.e: After an awkward pause, Bill took her by the hand and dragged her upstairs.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑地面↑↓じめん↓が↑沈↑↓しず↓んでいくのを↑感↑↓かん↓じた。
↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑太陽↑↓たいよう↓が↑山↑↓やま↓の↑後↑↓うし↓ろに↑沈↑↓しず↓むのを↑眺↑↓なが↓めた。
sdata.e: We watched the sun setting behind the mountains.

sdata.j: みじめな↑連敗↑↓れんぱい↓で↑我々↑↓われわれ↓は↑意気↑↓いき↓↑消沈↑↓しょうちん↓した。
sdata.e: A miserable sequence of defeats discouraged us.

sdata.j: まるで↑太陽↑↓たいよう↓が↑沈↑↓しず↓んでしまったかのように↑空↑↓そら↓は↑暗↑↓くら↓くなった。
sdata.e: The sky became as dark as if the sun had sunk.

sdata.j: ボートは↑湖↑↓みずうみ↓の↑底↑↓そこ↓に↑沈↑↓しず↓んだ。
sdata.e: The boat sank to the bottom of the lake.

words.gloss: to sink, to go under, to submerge
